Sentencas: This work tests the hypothesis that the surface oxygen exchange rate and bulk oxygen anion diffusivity are intrinsically linked in mixed ion-electron conducting oxides.
Titulo: On the link between bulk and surface properties of mixed ion electron conducting materials Ln0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ (Ln = La, Pr, Nd)

Sentencas: In contrast to other studies that measure these parameters in a linked experiment, this study combines data from in situ neutron powder diffraction (NPD), synchrotron X-ray diffraction (XRD), pulse isotopic oxygen exchange, X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) studies of Ln(0.5)Sr(0.5)Co(0.8)Fe(0.2)O(3-delta) (Ln = La, Pr, Nd) solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) cathode materials.
Titulo: On the link between bulk and surface properties of mixed ion electron conducting materials Ln0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ (Ln = La, Pr, Nd)

Sentencas: The Pr and Nd containing materials were found to exhibit higher oxygen exchange rates and decreased electrode impedance when compared to the La-based material.
Titulo: On the link between bulk and surface properties of mixed ion electron conducting materials Ln0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ (Ln = La, Pr, Nd)

Sentencas: It is proposed that the observed increase in performance is directly linked to high oxygen mobility in the Pr and Nd containing materials.
Titulo: On the link between bulk and surface properties of mixed ion electron conducting materials Ln0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ (Ln = La, Pr, Nd)

Sentencas: The oxygen mobility is characterized in terms of the oxygen vacancy concentration and oxygen atomic displacement derived from the NPD data.
Titulo: On the link between bulk and surface properties of mixed ion electron conducting materials Ln0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-δ (Ln = La, Pr, Nd)
